Cognitive Film Editing: Examines how film editing creates continuity and narrative integration despite shot changes, focusing on cognitive theories like AToCC and SPECT.
Cinema as Language Debate: Explores historical debate on whether film editing constitutes a unique language, comparing theorists like Mitry and Metz on cinematic syntax.
Neural Response Analysis: Uses EEG and ERD/ERS to detect neural patterns in response to cuts, testing if editing functions as an articulatory mechanism.
Shot Scale Effects: Discusses how different shot scales (e.g., close-ups vs. long shots) impact viewer engagement, emotion, and narrative understanding during cuts.
